availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah L. Trayler Wilds in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on June 8, 1846. Father of George J. Wilds, Mary Wilds, Josephus Wilds, Samuel Wilds, and Cordelia G. T. Wilds. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Employed William R. Layfield as a laborer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed Sarah Walker as a domestic servant in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed H. W. Morse as a farmhand in Caldwell County in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 296A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 62.
"Decator Wilds (1817-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #18569167, accessed October 6, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18569167.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994029, Caldwell County Births, p. 141.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
